channel.title: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: As The Gaza Strip Calms Down, The West Bank Heats Up
item.description: The shooting has stopped in Gaza, but the Israelis and Palestinians are now at odds over a large chunk of West Bank land where Israel plans to build more homes for settlers.
item.content:encoded:
The shooting has stopped in Gaza, but the Israelis and Palestinians are now at odds over a large chunk of West Bank land where Israel plans to build more homes for settlers.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Emily Harris

item.title: The Latest Word From WHO On Experimental Ebola Therapies
item.description: Vaccinations and therapeutics are being tested. Some could be available for use as early as November, if they prove to be safe.
item.content:encoded:
Vaccinations and therapeutics are being tested. Some could be available for use as early as November, if they prove to be safe.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: Obama: Our Goal Is To 'Dismantle' The Islamic State
item.description: After meeting with allies, the president said he found conviction that it was the responsibility of the international community to "degrade and ultimately destroy" the militant Sunni group.
item.content:encoded:
After meeting with allies, the president said he found conviction that it was the responsibility of the international community to "degrade and ultimately destroy" the militant Sunni group.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: A Diplomat Infects A Doctor As Ebola Spreads In Nigeria
item.description: The diplomat violated a quarantine. The doctor became ill but still saw patients. Now Africa's most populous country is scrambling to find more than 200 people who could have Ebola.
item.content:encoded:
The diplomat violated a quarantine. The doctor became ill but still saw patients. Now Africa's most populous country is scrambling to find more than 200 people who could have Ebola.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Richard Knox

item.title: Pentagon Says Drone Strike Killed Leader Of Militant Group Al-Shabab
item.description: The United States launched airstrikes in Somalia on Monday targeting Ahmed Abdi Godane, a co-founder of the al-Qaida affiliate in Somalia.
item.content:encoded:
The United States launched airstrikes in Somalia on Monday targeting Ahmed Abdi Godane, a co-founder of the al-Qaida affiliate in Somalia.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: Ukraine Says It Reached A Cease-Fire Deal With Separatists
item.description: Ukraine and the Russia-backed rebels have announced a cease-fire agreement set to go into effect Friday.
item.content:encoded:
Ukraine and the Russia-backed rebels have announced a cease-fire agreement set to go into effect Friday.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: In Ukraine, Cease-Fire Between Government, Separatists Takes Hold
item.description: Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko said he was hopeful that this would be a long-lasting peace. The central disagreements in conflict, however, remain.
item.content:encoded:
Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko said he was hopeful that this would be a long-lasting peace. The central disagreements in conflict, however, remain.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: U.S. Announces Coalition To Fight Against The Islamic State
item.description: Secretary of State John Kerry said the coalition will support U.S. allies on the ground and continue to use airstrikes on militants. Kerry ruled out any "boots on the ground."
item.content:encoded:
Secretary of State John Kerry said the coalition will support U.S. allies on the ground and continue to use airstrikes on militants. Kerry ruled out any "boots on the ground."

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: U.S. Expresses Concern That Syria May Still Have Chemical Weapons
item.description: The U.N. official in charge of coordinating the removal of Syria's chemical stockpile said they found discrepancies in the country's accounting of its arsenal.
item.content:encoded:
The U.N. official in charge of coordinating the removal of Syria's chemical stockpile said they found discrepancies in the country's accounting of its arsenal.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: NATO Announces 'Rapid-Reaction Force' Amid News Of Ukraine Cease-Fire Deal
item.description: Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko said he and a rebel leader had agreed to a cease-fire, which is part of Russian President Vladimir Putin's seven-point plan toward peace.
item.content:encoded:
Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko said he and a rebel leader had agreed to a cease-fire, which is part of Russian President Vladimir Putin's seven-point plan toward peace.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: Hundreds Of Chechens Join ISIS, Including Group's No. 2 Leader
item.description: Rebels from Chechnya have joined ranks with other jihadists in ISIS. David Greene talks to Gordan Hahn, author of Russia's Islamic Threat and an analyst for the Geostrategic Forecasting Corporation.
item.content:encoded:
Rebels from Chechnya have joined ranks with other jihadists in ISIS. David Greene talks to Gordan Hahn, author of Russia's Islamic Threat and an analyst for the Geostrategic Forecasting Corporation.

» E-Mail This

item.title: Romanian Hub Used By U.S. Military Is In A Strategic Location
item.description: There are 30,000 U.S. troops in Afghanistan and 20,000 will head home shortly. Millions of them transited in and out through a base in Kyrgyzstan, until the government there didn't renew the lease.
item.content:encoded:
There are 30,000 U.S. troops in Afghanistan and 20,000 will head home shortly. Millions of them transited in and out through a base in Kyrgyzstan, until the government there didn't renew the lease.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Sean Carberry

item.title: Hong Kong Activists To Counter China's Electoral Interference
item.description: Don Gonyea talks to Anson Chan, former chief secretary of Hong Kong, about China exercising control over Hong Kong's next leadership election. Pro-democracy supporters are outraged.
item.content:encoded:
Don Gonyea talks to Anson Chan, former chief secretary of Hong Kong, about China exercising control over Hong Kong's next leadership election. Pro-democracy supporters are outraged.

» E-Mail This

item.title: Ukraine Crisis Requires A New Rulebook, Author Says
item.description: David Greene talks to Edward Lucas, senior editor at The Economist and author of The New Cold War, about what moves NATO should be considering in response to Russian military moves in Ukraine.
item.content:encoded:
David Greene talks to Edward Lucas, senior editor at The Economist and author of The New Cold War, about what moves NATO should be considering in response to Russian military moves in Ukraine.

» E-Mail This

item.title: How Do We Stop Ebola? WHO Declares War On The Virus
item.description: Over the next six months, about 20,000 people will get Ebola. Half will likely die. To stop the virus, the World Health Organization says it needs thousands of health care workers and $600 million.
item.content:encoded:
Over the next six months, about 20,000 people will get Ebola. Half will likely die. To stop the virus, the World Health Organization says it needs thousands of health care workers and $600 million.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff
